description.narrative: Building A Resilient Community Health System to Prevent Infectious Diseases in Post-Ebola Sierra Leone

comment.narrative:
100 PHU structures assessed in 2016 100 VDC’s mobilised in 2016 for community led development
100 health plans developed in 2016 by 100 VDC’s 100 communities in 6 chiefdoms have implemented improvement of WASH features in 2016. This will be built upon for further investment in maternal, child and adolescent health features within the target communities 100 communities in 2016 previously undergoing the development of tailored community sensitisation material 100 communities in 2016 that have access to modified or newly disseminated health promotion materials # of PHUs in 2016 previously mobilized for the sensitization of residing communities

description.narrative:
Number of assessments/maps of existing community structures Number of health/development committees capacity strengthened
Number of health infrastructure development plans developed by local authorities through participatory processes Number of community based monitoring teams Number of infrastructure rehabilitation interventions implemented in target border communities to improve health infrastructures in accordance to the plans developed Number of people that have improved access to health services Number of culturally and linguistically relevant health promotion material developed and/or modified with specific attention given to maternal, child and adolescent health priorities Number of people that have access to health promotion materials Number of outreach activities conducted by local health workforce (MCHP) Number of people accessed through health outreach activities

comment.narrative:
-Rehabilitation/construction of 12 Maternal Child Health Care Post, and 12 staff quarters, in 12 selected communities have been completed and handed over to the District Health Management Team and Local Council. -Capacities of 12 health /facility management committees were strengthened.
-12 health infrastructure development plans were developed by VDC and FMC members. -Assessment was conducted in 13 MCHPs. However, 12 MCHPs were selected to benefit from the intervention. -16 community-based health infrastructural teams were set up to oversee the rehabilitation/construction of 12 MCHPs and staff quarters in Kambia and Kailahun District respectively. -1,800 health promotion materials jointly developed and disseminated to community members by the VDCs, FMC, and District Social Mobilization coordinato. 12 Motorbikes given to District Council ij Kambia to support in the Community awareness activities. -840 people benefited from the health promotion materials developed and disseminated at community level. -18 women Village savings and loan groups established, trained and supported with startup kits and seed capital to enhance the operation of the scheme. - 120 vulnerable youths including young women benefited from the cash for work provided for their active involvement in the rehabilitation/construction of their MCHPs and staff quarters.
